channel.title: Coming back from a lonnggg break!
channel.description:
Alright well title says it all.. i used to help friends with their servers.. simple coding and all that good stuff but i took about a year break and honestly.. i can't remember anything!.. but mainly i just have a few questions!! [b]Be noob-friendly! :][/b]
- How do i change the source to connect to my server?.
- I need a client that will work with FINAL Devolution 2.7
- How do i configure the client to connect to my server?
[b](I know about no-ip and all that good stuff just don't remember where to edit these things at.)[/b]
[size=10pt]Any help is appreciated, thank you guys for looking![/size]

item.title: Coming back from a lonnggg break!
item.dc:creator: @sorakbm sorakbm
item.description:
@sorakbm wrote:

[quote=“iDontRun, post:2, topic:333095”]To be honest with you, i don’t belive you were ever a coder at one point.
If you were, even from the longest brake possible you would know how to answer these questions very easily.

1st off, to change the source to connect to your server? You don’t have to… its a source, unless it has anti leech it should connect to your Ip.

2nd You should be able to find a client in server, downloads etc…

3rd To make the client to connect to your ip go to either client.java or egu.java something along the lines of that.

4th, read next time before you post, it says no request aloud, so don’t request…
Next time don’t act like you were a pro coder and just be straight forward…[/quote]

I figured someone would say that… and in all honesty i did code… i never said i was a pro coder… i just don’t remember where the stuff was…

Read full topic
item.source: Coming back from a lonnggg break!

item.title: Coming back from a lonnggg break!
item.dc:creator: @iDontRun iDontRun
item.description:
@iDontRun wrote:

To be honest with you, i don’t belive you were ever a coder at one point.
If you were, even from the longest brake possible you would know how to answer these questions very easily.

1st off, to change the source to connect to your server? You don’t have to… its a source, unless it has anti leech it should connect to your Ip.

2nd You should be able to find a client in server, downloads etc…

3rd To make the client to connect to your ip go to either client.java or egu.java something along the lines of that.

4th, read next time before you post, it says no request aloud, so don’t request…
Next time don’t act like you were a pro coder and just be straight forward…

Read full topic
